thread.title: Bad weather is always a good omen for Phillipsburg's football team
thread.title_full: Bad weather is always a good omen for Phillipsburg's football team

title: Bad weather is always a good omen for Phillipsburg's football team
text:
When the skies open up and the rain starts pelting down on the field, it’s usually a good omen for Phillipsburg High School’s football team. 
Historically, the Stateliners seem to thrive in inclement weather. 
P’burg turned in another stellar performance on the sloppy Maloney Stadium grass on Friday night. 
The Stateliners jumped on Franklin right from the get-go and didn’t let up until they’d posted a 42-6 Mid-State 38 Conference Delaware Division victory. 
Most of the game was played in a steady rain, and it seemed to play right into the hands of the Stateliners (3-1). 
RELATED : P'burg football players, fans honor Warren Hills' Evan Murray 
“P’burg kids are sort of built for this kind of weather,” Stateliners coach Ryan Ditze said. “The key thing is they focus on themselves, and when you do that you don’t have to worry about outside factors.” 
How efficient has P’burg been in nasty weather? Well, all you have to do is take a recent history check to find the answer. 
Perhaps most impressive is that P’burg has continually thrived on the big stage in bad weather. The Stateliners’ last three sectional titles – Ridge (34-7 win in 2009), Mendham (39-0 in 2013) and Colonia (28-21 in overtime in 2014) – were all played in horrible weather conditions. 
Furthermore, P’burg celebrated a 3-0 overtime win over Easton in a snowstorm on Thanksgiving in 2010. That happened to be former coach Bob Stem’s last game. 
It’s also worth pointing out that P’burg knocked off Easton again last year – 19-15 – after another snowstorm pushed the game back two days. 
Friday’s game didn’t start out so well as Stateliners junior quarterback Danny Fisher was intercepted on the first play from scrimmage. But P’burg’s defense quickly restored order, got the ball into the offense’s capable hands, and it wasn’t long before the Stateliners were on their way to another convincing win in the muck and mire.
